docs.lead_paragraph: Readers decry the prospect of higher premiums that they say will enrich insurance companies but hurt consumers.

headline.main: Health Insurers’ Request for Higher Rates

docs.snippet: Readers decry the prospect of higher premiums that they say will enrich insurance companies but hurt consumers.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

docs.lead_paragraph: Medicare is proposing to reimburse doctors for having conversations with patients about whether and how they would want to be kept alive if they became too sick to speak for themselves.

headline.main: Medicare Plans to Pay Doctors for Counseling on End of Life
headline.print_headline: Medicare Plans to Pay Doctors for Counseling on End of Life

docs.abstract: Medicare announces that it is rolling out proposal in which doctors will be reimbursed for conversations with patients about end-of-life planning, to take effect in January 2016; plan will be open for comment for 60 days; major medical organizations welcome proposal, which will settle debate that rose up during passage of Affordable Care Act about whether such conversations will lead to rationing of care.
docs.snippet: Medicare is proposing to reimburse doctors for having conversations with patients about whether and how they would want to be kept alive if they became too sick to speak for themselves.

keywords.value: Living Wills and Health Care Proxies
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Deepak Jayasimha's fitness tracker is now with his father-in-law in India, where it sits unused. Annabel Kelly foisted hers off on the kids. Virginia Atkinson took hers off to charge the battery and hasn't picked it up since February.

headline.main: Strong Sales, but High Abandonment for Fitness Trackers
headline.print_headline: Strong Sales, but High Abandonment for Fitness Trackers

docs.snippet: Deepak Jayasimha's fitness tracker is now with his father-in-law in India, where it sits unused. Annabel Kelly foisted hers off on the kids. Virginia Atkinson took hers off to charge the battery and hasn't picked it up since February.

docs.lead_paragraph: An expert who looked at the files of 100 patients of a Detroit-area cancer doctor facing prison for unnecessary treatments testified Wednesday that the records were disturbing.

headline.print_headline: Expert Testifies Against Cancer Doctor at Sentencing Hearing

docs.snippet: An expert who looked at the files of 100 patients of a Detroit-area cancer doctor facing prison for unnecessary treatments testified Wednesday that the records were disturbing.

docs.lead_paragraph: A cyber attack which shuts down parts of the United States' power grid could cost as much as $1 trillion to the U.S. economy, according to a report published on Wednesday.

headline.main: Cyber Attack on U.S. Power Grid Could Cost Economy $1 Trillion: Report
headline.print_headline: Cyber Attack on U.S. Power Grid Could Cost Economy $1 Trillion: Report

docs.snippet: A cyber attack which shuts down parts of the United States' power grid could cost as much as $1 trillion to the U.S. economy, according to a report published on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: House Republicans are proposing that some forest fires be treated like federal disasters, an attempt to win broader support for legislation that targets overgrown national forest lands.

headline.main: House GOP Effort Would Tap Disaster Fund for Some Wildfires
headline.print_headline: House GOP Effort Would Tap Disaster Fund for Some Wildfires

docs.snippet: House Republicans are proposing that some forest fires be treated like federal disasters, an attempt to win broader support for legislation that targets overgrown national forest lands.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new analysis found out-of-pocket spending on the pill dropped by about half in the first six months of 2013 compared with a year earlier.

headline.main: After Health Care Act, Sharp Drop in Spending on Birth Control
headline.print_headline: Women Are Paying Less for Birth Control, Study Finds

docs.abstract: Study published online in Health Affairs finds that passage of Affordable Care Act has resulted in women spending far less out-of-pocket for most birth control methods; estimates cost savings from birth control pill alone, most popular form of birth control, was around $1.4 billion in 2013.
docs.snippet: A new analysis found out-of-pocket spending on the pill dropped by about half in the first six months of 2013 compared with a year earlier.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Congressional Republicans are using the budget process to try to dismantle President Obama’s policies, setting up a fiscal feud this fall that could lead to a government shutdown.

headline.main: Republicans Aim to Hamper Obama’s Policies With Spending Bills
headline.print_headline: Budget Process Sets Stage for New Impasse in Fall

docs.abstract: Republicans in Congress are churning out spending bills aimed at dismantling many of Pres Obama's policies on varied issues, all of which stick to 2011 spending limit that Obama has said he will not accept; bills are setting up another fiscal battle that raises specter of another government shutdown.
docs.snippet: Congressional Republicans are using the budget process to try to dismantle President Obama’s policies, setting up a fiscal feud this fall that could lead to a government shutdown.
